newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak c.bank sets tender for 3-day repo - 1000 CET.
newsitem.headline: Slovak c.bank sets tender for 3-day repo - 1000 CET.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) on Friday said it had set a tender for a three-day securities repurchase for 1000 CET, offering banks liquidity of a fixed volume of one billion crowns.
The NBS said in a statement that the American-style tender would have a minimum rate of 9.7 percent.
According to official NBS figures, the Slovak banking sector is short of liquidity, with banks' minimum reserve demands fulfilled at 98.18 percent as of Thursday.
The NBS holds tenders on a daily basis if needed at 1000 CET (0900 GMT), instead of quoting securities repo and reverse repo rates.
Tender results are released by 1100 CET with allocations following later in the day.
